metadata.title: CVE-2017-14062 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
Integer overflow in the decode_digit function in puny_decode.c in Libidn2before 2.0.4 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service orpossibly have unspecified other impact.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-14062` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

idn - 1.28-1ubuntu2.2
libidn11 - 1.28-1ubuntu2.2
libidn11-java - 1.28-1ubuntu2.2
No subscription required

idn2 - 0.9-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
libidn2-0 - 0.9-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: libidn package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.28-1ubuntu2.2').
libidn2-0 package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.9-1ubuntu0.1~esm1').
